page.title: 13Buslingthorpe Village/Church
page.content: { Buslingthorpe}is the site of a mediaeval village. Opposite the{church the land is covered with hummocks and hollows and nobody is allowed to plough it. There is a moat around the Manor House. It has some water in it, but not very much. It is clean enough for ducks to swim in. The{church}was rebuilt in 1835 but the stone tower and the chancel arch are 13th Century. There is a fragment of mediaeval glass in the form of a shield in the East window. Inside there is a brass of Sir Richard {Buslingthorpe}wearing chain mail. His heart is between his hands which are protected by plated gloves. It is thought to be dated about 1290. If so, it is one of the oldest in the country.
